That's yer problem...... you need this plate to ramp into the chamber... that way yer brass won't get stuck... ... there ya go, should be better...No problem.No, not me. I ain't the military type. Tell em they're comin inside. Crazy as it sounds, God spoke to me...I'm gonna build a church.Right across the street. Not like Faith United or Calvary Fellowship. You boys is soundin pretty good up here.I wanna thank ya'll for comin out for the first day of worship here at Shekinah Fellowship Church.The guest preacher we had booked today ain't shown up... so I thought I'd say a word or two.Lotta yous been wonderin what made me wanna build this here church. Seein as I ain't the best seed in the bunch I can understand that.Buncha years ago I was runnin from some bad fellas in the woods over there by Cleary. Those old boys was comin after me hard and I reached in my bag lookin for my old shotgun but it was gone. My momma had took it out when I wasn't lookin and put this bible in there instead...Well I figured I was done for, so I sat down under an old tree with this useless book and I waited...... and then the strangest thing happened. Them boys ran right on past me. Didn't even see me sittin there. Now the way I figure it, things would have turned out pretty different if I had pulled out that shotgun instead of this here Bible. Feed another thousand a day from nearby villages. Two million have lost their lives...... these people have been driven from their villages, however these camps are not much better...Cholera and Malaria are everywhere, there is little food and not enough UN soldiers to protect everyone. Even here they worry the LRA will attack at night.Yes.I'm sorry, Sam... I'll be five minutes.Some say Joseph Kony is a wizard. A shapeshifter. He calls himself a Christian...... but I say he is Satan, who devours his own people.He is the one we have been fighting for years. But there is very little we can do. Our weapons are old, and our boots are full of holes. We have been forgotten by the rest of the world.Why are you here?What are you looking for in this place?And then you will get your picture and go back to your life and all this will just be a story you tell your friends.They are night commuters. They come from deep in the bush. Their parents send them out because it is safer to sleep here than in their own homes.Because death comes at night in the villages and refugee camps.These are the lucky one so far. The ones the rebels have not found. The invisible children.Where are you going?Sam...What are you doing?Sam, there are too many...... you can't help them all.Settle down... it's alright... you can sleep here till morning...The LRA attacked a village last night.You said you wanted to see.You came all this way to bring us new boots?Sam, wait...It is not safe here.Sam... this is Betty. She is from the village of Kotido. A few miles from here.She is knowing that you need someone to run the orphanage.She can do this.What is this `darn it?'This is not funny. In my language, in Arabic, names are very important. They tell you everything about a man. Your name proceeds you wherever you go. You are Sam. This is how you are known. In my language this means something.Small penis.Of course.I was raised to believe there was a God in heaven.But it is impossible to live here, to see what I have seen, and not turn your back on him.I don't think so.Two squads... There -- and there.I don't know.To the church! --Four on the right!All the way around...Preacher, you need to come see this.The Acholi people were farmers before they were driven from their ancestral homeland. Each year they blessed the soil before a planting.They are saying that fire brings strength and ashes abundance...... when the land burns, the next year the soil produces more...... she says you are a farmer and these children are your crops...... and this ground is richer now and they will grow stronger because of it.Their village was hit out Adjumani.Sam...Where are you going?Sam, please wait...Why don't you just go home?This is not your war.Looks like you've got yourself a bodyguard.I will, Preacher.Get out of there.Come on! -- out! --That's our leader.Some of the child soldiers say there is a bounty on your life. That Kony is offering money for your nose and ears.I'd like to assign a few more men to you during the day.All we know is that his family was killed and that he and his brother were taken into the LRA.Nobody knows.This is it.A.J. is dead.Don't move!Did you see him?!He did not see.Yes. He's on the ridge... just below that outcropping.I think you got him!It is ok. You can get up now.Sam.LRA wanted us here.An LRA convoy has moved north over the border. They're heading for Ed Duim.Look...The truck is too damaged to move. We don't have room for them all, Preacher.Bring the children out...Put them together here... gently...What are you doing?It's ok... he will not hurt you...We will be back for you!Hide until we return!Welcome back.Do you hear that, Preacher?There is no more laughter. The children do not play here anymore. They are scared once again. But now they are scared of you.The men do not trust you any longer to lead them into battle. They say you have a wish to die. I am worried about my friend. I want to help him.Some of the soldiers said he was asking about the commander that is being held at Kismoro.They have not see the boy.It will be light soon. What do you want to do?The village outside of Akot says an LRA caravan came through there an hour ago. They were headed for Ed Duim.Take them out.Cut the ropes!
